hero.name: Saeed Abdul Muizz.
hero.description: I'm a Mechanical Engineering student at NIT Srinagar. I specialize in bridging the gap between core engineering and Deep Learning, with my current focus on Kashmiri NLP.

achievements.title: HackMIT 2025 Selectee
achievements.description: Selected to attend MIT's flagship hackathon.

achievements.title: GitHub Campus Expert
achievements.description: Selected as one of many students globally to lead developer communities and promote open-source

paragraphs: Hello! My name is Saeed. I enjoy tackling complex problems where Mechanical Engineering meets Artificial Intelligence. Currently, I'm a 2nd-year student at NIT Srinagar.
My research journey started at Gaash Lab, where I work on low-resource language processing, specifically trying to bring Kashmiri into the digital age through Neural Machine Translation (NMT).
When I'm not training models or solving differential equations, I'm freelancing on Fiverr (automating boring stuff with Python) or organizing tech events as a Campus Expert.

tasks: Evaluated performance of IndicTrans2, MADLAD-400, gemma-translate, nllb and Sarvam Translate models.
Fine-tuning (LoRa and QLoRa) LLMs on 48k+ sentence pairs using PyTorch and Unsloth for optimized inference.
Completed 25+ automation and web scraping projects with a 5-star rating.
Built custom bots for data extraction and workflow automation using Selenium and BeautifulSoup.
Helped in organizing CodeDay Kashmir and managed logistics for college technical fests.
Mentoring juniors in Python programming and Git/GitHub basics.

projects.title: Hadith Verification Bot
projects.description: A Telegram bot hosted on AWS EC2 that verifies Hadith authenticity. Scrapes reliable databases using BeautifulSoup and serves results via API.

projects.title: Kashmiri AI Translator and TTS
projects.description: A specialized tool designed to translate English text into Kashmiri and generate natural sounding speech. I used GitHub Copilot and Vercel to develop and deploy the frontend whereas for backend I used Gradio's API and Hugging Face spaces. I also contributed in creating the NMT model used in the backend at Gaash Lab.

projects.title: KashmiriNormalizer
projects.description: Text normalizer for kashmiri that handles data preprocessing and postprocessing to make it feasible to train ML models for Kashmiri Language.
